targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  create_time AS "time",
  progress
FROM ca_analysis
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(create_time)
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Charts are organized by the Research & Development stages below

options.content: Cross-stage Metrics

panels.description:
1. The average lead time of requirements.
2. Lead time refers to the length of time from requirement creation to delivery.
3. The requirements being calculated are filtered by "requirement resolution time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board"("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select 
  now() as time,
  avg(lead_time/1440) as value
from jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
where 
  std_type = 'Requirement' 
  and resolution_date is not null
  and lead_time is not null
  and std_status = 'Resolved'
  and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id
group by 1;

panels.title: Avg Requirement Lead Time (day)

panels.description:
1. The lead time at which 80% requirementsâ€˜ lead time lies below it.
2. The requirements being calculated are filtered by "requirement resolution time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    ji.lead_time,
    percent_rank() over (order by lead_time asc) as ranks
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and resolution_date is not null
    and lead_time is not null
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select
  now() as time,
  max(lead_time/1440) as value
from _ranks
where 
  ranks <= 0.8
group by 1

panels.title: 80th Percentile Requirement Lead Time (day)

panels.description:
1. The average and 80th percentile requirement lead time over time.
2. The time granularity can be switched to Week or Month by "Time Interval" above. 
3. When Time Interval is set to "Month", the average_lead_time of "2021-06-01" refers to the average lead time of requirements whose resolution time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01).

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select 
    ji.id,
    DATE_ADD(date(resolution_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(resolution_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    lead_time,
    round(lead_time/1440) as lead_time_day
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and resolution_date is not null
    and lead_time is not null
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  timestamp(time) as time,
  avg(lead_time/1440) as average_lead_time
  -- percent_rank() over (order by lead_time_day asc) as percentile_80_lead_time
from _requirement
group by 1
order by 1 asc

panels.title: Requirement Lead Time over Time

panels.description:
1. The cumulative distribution of requirement lead time. 
2. Each point refers to the percent rank of a lead time.

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    round(ji.lead_time/1440) as lead_time_day
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and resolution_date is not null
    and lead_time is not null
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  order by lead_time_day asc
)

select 
  now() as time,
  lpad(concat(lead_time_day,'d'), 4, ' ') as metric,
  percent_rank() over (order by lead_time_day asc) as value
from _ranks
order by lead_time_day asc

panels.title: Requirement Lead Time (Cumulative Distribution)

panels.description: The average lead time of requirements under different Jira Epics.

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select
    ji.id,
    ji.epic_key,
    ji.lead_time
  from
    jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and resolution_date is not null
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and epic_key is not null
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  now() as time,
  epic_key as metric,
  avg(lead_time) as value
from _requirement
group by 1,2
order by avg(lead_time) desc
limit 10

panels.title: Average Requirement Lead Time (Breakdown by Epic)

options.content: Requirement

panels.description:
1. Total number of requirements created.
2. The requirements being calculated are filtered by "requirement creation time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select 
  now() as time,
  count(*) as value
from jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
where 
  std_type = 'Requirement'
  and created is not null 
  and $__timeFilter(created)
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id
group by 1;

panels.title: Requirement Count (Total)

panels.description:
1. The number of requirements created over time.
2. The time granularity can be switched to week or month by "Time Interval" above. 
3. When Time Interval is set to "month", the requirement_count of "2021-06-01" refers to the number of requirements whose creation time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01)

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select
    ji.id,
    DATE_ADD(date(created), INTERVAL -$interval(date(created))+1 DAY) as time
  from
    jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and created is not null 
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select
  timestamp(time) as time,
  count(distinct id) as requirement_count
from _requirement
group by 1
order by 1 asc

panels.title: Requirement Count (Breakdown by Time)

panels.description: 1. The number of requirements under different Jira Epics.

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select
    ji.id,
    ji.epic_key
  from
    jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and created is not null
    and epic_key is not null
    and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  now() as time,
  epic_key as metric,
  count(*) as value
from _requirement
group by 1,2
order by 3 desc
limit 20

panels.title: Requirement Count (Breakdown by Epic)

panels.description:
1. Number of requirements that have been delivered.
2. A requirement is delivered when its status equals 'delivered'.
3. The requirements being calculated are filtered by "requirement creation time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select
  now() as time,
  count(*) as delivered_count
from jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
where 
  std_type = 'Requirement'
  and ji.resolution_date is not null
  and created is not null
  and $__timeFilter(created)
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id

panels.title: Delivered Requirement Count

panels.description: Delivered Requirement Count/Requirement Count (Total)

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select
    count(distinct ji.id) as total_count,
    count(distinct case when ji.std_status = 'Resolved' then ji.id else null end) as delivered_count
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and created is not null
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)


select 
  now() as time,
  1.0 * delivered_count/total_count as requirement_delivery_rate
from _requirement

panels.title: Requirement Delivery Rate

panels.description:
1. The requirement delivery rate over time.
2. When Time Interval is set to "month", value "requirement_delivery_rate" of "2021-06-01" calculates the requirements whose creation time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01)

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select
    DATE_ADD(date(created), INTERVAL -$interval(date(created))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct ji.id) as total_count,
    count(distinct case when ji.std_status = 'Resolved' then ji.id else null end) as delivered_count
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and created is not null
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  group by 1
)


select 
  timestamp(time) as time,
  1.0 * delivered_count/total_count as requirement_delivery_rate
from _requirement
order by 1

panels.title: Requirement Delivery Rate over Time

panels.description: The average delivery rate of requirements under different Jira Epics.

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select
    ji.epic_key as metric,
    count(distinct ji.id) as total_count,
    count(distinct case when ji.std_status = 'Resolved' then ji.id else null end) as delivered_count
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and created is not null
    and epic_key is not null
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  group by 1
)


select 
  now() as time,
  metric,
  1.0 * delivered_count/total_count as requirement_delivery_rate
from _requirement
order by 3 desc
limit 10

panels.title: Requirement Delivery Rate by Epic

panels.description:
1. The average story point (workload) of requirements.
2. The requirements being calculated are filtered by "requirement creation time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select 
  now() as time,
  avg(std_workload) as value
from jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
where 
  std_type = 'Requirement'
  and created is not null
  and std_workload != 0
  and $__timeFilter(created)
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id
group by 1;

panels.title: Avg Requirement Granunarity(StoryPoint)

panels.description:
1. The story point/estimated hours at which 80% requirements' story point/estimated hours lies below it.
2. The requirements being calculated are filtered by "requirement creation time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    std_workload,
    percent_rank() over (order by std_workload asc) as ranks
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and created is not null
    and std_workload != 0
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select
  now() as time,
  max(std_workload) as value
from _ranks
where 
  ranks <= 0.8
group by 1

panels.title: 80th Percentile Requirement Granunarity(Story point)

panels.description: The average and 80th percentile requirement granularity over time.

targets.rawSql:
with _requirement as(
  select 
    ji.id,
    DATE_ADD(date(resolution_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(resolution_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    std_workload
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and created is not null
    and std_workload != 0
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  timestamp(time) as time,
  avg(std_workload) as average_story_point
  -- percentile_disc(0.8) within group (order by lead_time asc) as percentile_80_lead_time
from _requirement
group by 1
order by 1 asc

panels.title: Requirement Granularity over Time

panels.description:
1. The cumulative distribution of requirement granularity.
2. Each point refers to the percent rank of a value of granularity.

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    round(std_workload) as std_workload
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Requirement'
    and created is not null
    and std_workload != 0
    and $__timeFilter(created)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  order by std_workload asc
)

select 
  now() as time,
  lpad(std_workload, 4, ' ') as metric,
  percent_rank() over (order by std_workload asc) as value
from _ranks
order by std_workload asc

panels.title: Requirement Granularity (Cumulative Distribution)

options.content: Development

panels.description:
1. Average PR/MR review time.
2. PR/MR review time refers to the time between the assigned reviewersâ€˜ first comment and Pull/Merge Request being merged.
3. The PR/MR being calculated are filtered by "PR/MR creation time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Gitlab repo"("Choose Repo" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select 
  now() as time,
  avg(EXTRACT(epoch from age(merged_at, first_comment_time)) / 86400) as value
from gitlab_merge_requests
WHERE
  first_comment_time is not null
  and merged_at is not null
  and $__timeFilter(gitlab_created_at)
  and project_id = $repo_id

panels.title: Avg Pull Request Review Time (day)

panels.description:
1. The 80th percentile PR/MR review time.
2. The PR/MR being calculated are filtered by "PR/MR creation time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Gitlab repo"("Choose Repo" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select 
  now() as time,
  percentile_disc(0.8) within group 
    (order by (EXTRACT(epoch from age(merged_at, first_comment_time)) / 86400) asc) 
    as percentile_80_review_time
from gitlab_merge_requests
WHERE
  first_comment_time is not null
  and merged_at is not null
  and $__timeFilter(gitlab_created_at)
  and project_id = $repo_id

panels.title: 80% Pull Request Review Time <= (day)

panels.description:
1. The average and 80th percentile PR/MR review time over time.
2. The time granularity can be switched to week or month by "Time Interval" above. 
3. When Time Interval is set to "month", the average review time of "2021-06-01" refers to the review time of PR/MR whose creation time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01)

targets.rawSql:
with reviewed_mr as(
  select 
    to_char(gitlab_created_at, '$interval') as time,
    EXTRACT(epoch from age(merged_at, first_comment_time)) / 86400 as review_time
  from gitlab_merge_requests
  WHERE
    first_comment_time is not null
    and merged_at is not null
    and $__timeFilter(gitlab_created_at)
    and project_id = $repo_id
)

select 
  to_timestamp(time,'$interval') as time,
  avg(review_time) as average_review_time,
  percentile_disc(0.8) within group (order by review_time asc) as percentile_80_review_time
from reviewed_mr
group by 1
order by 1 asc

panels.title: Pull Request Review Time (Breakdown by Time)

panels.description:
1. Total number of commits created.
2. The commits being calculated are filtered by "authored_date" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Gitlab repo"("Choose Repo" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  now() AS "time",
  count(*) as value
FROM gitlab_commits
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(authored_date)
  and project_id = $repo_id
group by 1
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Commit Count (Total)

panels.description:
1. Number of commits created over time.
2. When Time Interval is set to "month", the commit_count" of "2021-06-01" calculates the commits whose creation time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01)

targets.rawSql:
with _commits as(
  SELECT
    to_char(authored_date, '$interval') as time,
    count(*) as commit_count
  FROM gitlab_commits
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(authored_date)
    and project_id = $repo_id
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  to_timestamp(time,'$interval') as time,
  commit_count
FROM _commits
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Commit Count (Breakdown by Time)

panels.description: The number of commits from different repos.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  now() as time,
  gp.name as repo_name,
  count(*) as value
FROM gitlab_commits gc 
  join gitlab_projects gp on gc.project_id = gp.id
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(authored_date)
  and gc.project_id = $repo_id
group by 1,2
order by 1

panels.title: Commit Count (Breakdown by Repo)

panels.description: The number of commits from different commit authors.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  now() as time,
  gc.author_name,
  count(*) as value
FROM gitlab_commits gc 
  join gitlab_projects gp on gc.project_id = gp.id
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(authored_date)
  and gc.project_id = $repo_id
group by 1,2
order by 3 desc

panels.title: Commit Count (Breakdown by Author)

panels.description:
1. Sum of the number of added lines of code under all commits.
2. The commits being calculated are filtered by "authored_date" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Gitlab repo"("Choose Repo" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  now() AS "time",
  sum(additions) as value
FROM gitlab_commits gc
  join gitlab_projects gp on gc.project_id = gp.id 
WHERE
  message not like '%Merge branch%'
  and $__timeFilter(authored_date)
  and gp.id = $repo_id
group by 1
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Added LOC (Total)

panels.description:
1. Sum of the number of deleted lines of code under all commits.
2. The commits being calculated are filtered by "authored_date" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Gitlab repo"("Choose Repo" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  now() AS "time",
  sum(deletions) as value
FROM gitlab_commits gc
  join gitlab_projects gp on gc.project_id = gp.id 
WHERE
  message not like '%Merge branch%'
  and $__timeFilter(authored_date)
  and gp.id = $repo_id
group by 1
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Deleted LOC (Total)

panels.description: Added/deleted number of lines of code over time.

targets.rawSql:
with loc as(
  SELECT
    to_char(authored_date, '$interval') as time,
    sum(additions) as added_LOC,
    sum(deletions) as deleted_LOC
  FROM gitlab_commits
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(authored_date)
    and project_id = $repo_id
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  to_timestamp(time,'$interval') as time,
  added_LOC,
  deleted_LOC
FROM loc
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Added and Deleted LOC (Breakdown by Time)

panels.description: The number of added/deleted LOC from different commit authors.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  now() as time,
  gc.author_name,
  sum(additions) as added_loc,
  sum(deletions) as removed_loc
FROM gitlab_commits gc 
  join gitlab_projects gp on gc.project_id = gp.id
WHERE
  author_name is not null
  and $__timeFilter(authored_date)
  and gc.project_id = $repo_id
group by 1,2
order by 3 desc

panels.title: Added and Deleted LOC (Breakdown by Author)

options.content: Test

panels.description:
1. The average bug age.
2. Bug age refers to the length of time from bug creation to resolution.
3. The bugs being calculated are filtered by "bug resolution time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board"("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select 
  now() as time,
  avg(lead_time/1440) as value
from jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
where 
  std_type = 'Bug'
  and resolution_date is not null
  and lead_time is not null
  -- and std_status = 'Resolved'
  and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id
group by 1;

panels.title: Average Bug Age (day)

panels.description:
1. The bug age at which 80% bugsâ€˜ age lies below it.
2. The bugs being calculated are filtered by "bug resolution time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    ji.lead_time,
    percent_rank() over (order by lead_time asc) as ranks
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Bug'
    and resolution_date is not null
    and lead_time is not null
    -- and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select
  now() as time,
  max(lead_time/1440) as value
from _ranks
where 
  ranks <= 0.8
group by 1

panels.title: 80th Percentile Bug Age (day)

panels.description:
1. The average and 80th percentile bug age over time.
2. The time granularity can be switched to Week or Month by "Time Interval" above. 
3. When Time Interval is set to "Month", the average_bug_age of "2021-06-01" refers to the average age of bugs whose resolution time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01).

targets.rawSql:
with _bugs as(
  select 
    ji.id,
    DATE_ADD(date(resolution_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(resolution_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    lead_time,
    round(lead_time/1440) as lead_time_day
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Bug'
    and resolution_date is not null
    and lead_time is not null
    -- and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  timestamp(time) as time,
  avg(lead_time/1440) as average_lead_time
  -- percent_rank() over (order by lead_time_day asc) as percentile_80_lead_time
from _bugs
group by 1
order by 1 asc

panels.title: Average Bug Age over Time

panels.description:
1. The cumulative distribution of bug age. 
2. Each point refers to the percent rank of a bug age.

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    round(ji.lead_time/1440) as lead_time_day
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Bug'
    and resolution_date is not null
    and lead_time is not null
    -- and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  order by lead_time_day asc
)

select 
  now() as time,
  lpad(concat(lead_time_day,'d'), 4, ' ') as metric,
  percent_rank() over (order by lead_time_day asc) as value
from _ranks
order by lead_time_day asc

panels.title: Bug Age (Cumulative Distribution)

panels.description: The average age of bugs under different Jira Epics.

targets.rawSql:
with _bugs as(
  select
    ji.id,
    ji.epic_key,
    ji.lead_time
  from
    jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Bug'
    and resolution_date is not null
    and epic_key is not null
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  now() as time,
  epic_key as metric,
  avg(lead_time) as value
from _bugs
group by 1,2
order by avg(lead_time) desc
limit 10

panels.title: Average Bug Age by Epic

options.content: Operation

panels.description:
1. The average incident age.
2. Incident age refers to the length of time from incident creation to resolution.
3. The incidents being calculated are filtered by "incident resolution time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board"("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
select 
  now() as time,
  avg(lead_time/1440) as value
from jira_issues ji
  join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
where 
  std_type = 'Incident'
  and created is not null
  and lead_time is not null
  -- and std_status = 'Resolved'
  and $__timeFilter(created)
  and jbi.board_id = $board_id
group by 1;

panels.title: Average Incident Age (day)

panels.description:
1. The incident age at which 80% incidentsâ€˜ age lies below it.
2. The incidents being calculated are filtered by "incident resolution time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    ji.lead_time,
    percent_rank() over (order by lead_time asc) as ranks
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Incident'
    and resolution_date is not null
    and lead_time is not null
    -- and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select
  now() as time,
  max(lead_time/1440) as value
from _ranks
where 
  ranks <= 0.8
group by 1

panels.title: 80th Percentile Incident Age (day)

panels.description:
1. The average and 80th percentile incident age over time.
2. The time granularity can be switched to Week or Month by "Time Interval" above. 
3. When Time Interval is set to "Month", the average_incident_age of "2021-06-01" refers to the average age of incidents whose resolution time falls under [2020-06-01, 2020-07-01).

targets.rawSql:
with _incidents as(
  select 
    ji.id,
    DATE_ADD(date(resolution_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(resolution_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    lead_time,
    round(lead_time/1440) as lead_time_day
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Incident'
    and resolution_date is not null
    and lead_time is not null
    -- and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  timestamp(time) as time,
  avg(lead_time/1440) as average_lead_time
  -- percent_rank() over (order by lead_time_day asc) as percentile_80_lead_time
from _incidents
group by 1
order by 1 asc

panels.title: Average Incident Age over Time

panels.description:
1. The cumulative distribution of incident age.
2. Each point refers to the percent rank of a incident age.

targets.rawSql:
with _ranks as(
  select 
    round(ji.lead_time/1440) as lead_time_day
  from jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    std_type = 'Incident'
    and resolution_date is not null
    and lead_time is not null
    -- and std_status = 'Resolved'
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
  order by lead_time_day asc
)

select 
  now() as time,
  lpad(concat(lead_time_day,'d'), 4, ' ') as metric,
  percent_rank() over (order by lead_time_day asc) as value
from _ranks
order by lead_time_day asc

panels.title: Incident Age (Cumulative Distribution)

panels.description: The average age of incidents under different Jira Epics.

targets.rawSql:
with _incidents as(
  select
    ji.id,
    ji.epic_key,
    ji.lead_time
  from
    jira_issues ji
    join jira_board_issues jbi on ji.id = jbi.issue_id
  where 
    type = 'Incident'
    and resolution_date is not null
    and epic_key is not null
    and $__timeFilter(resolution_date)
    and jbi.board_id = $board_id
)

select 
  now() as time,
  epic_key as metric,
  avg(lead_time) as value
from _incidents
group by 1,2
order by avg(lead_time) desc
limit 20

panels.title: Average Incident Age by Epic

list.definition: select distinct concat(name, ': ', id) from jira_boards
list.label: Choose Board
list.name: board_id
list.query: select distinct concat(name, ': ', id) from jira_boards

list.definition: select distinct concat(name, ': ', gitlab_id) from gitlab_projects
list.label: Choose Repo
list.name: repo_id
list.query: select distinct concat(name, ': ', gitlab_id) from gitlab_projects
